title: Microsoft Excel 2013 - Advanced: Master Spreadsheets
headline: Learn how to master spreadsheets with this free online Microsoft Excel advanced training course.
description: This free online Microsoft Excel 2013 advanced training course will teach you how to use advanced functions and formulas in Excel, and supercharge your Excel skills. You will learn how to use functions and do statistical analysis of data in Excel. This course is aimed at learners with an existing understanding of Excel looking to multiply their spreadsheet productivity. Start this course today to take your spreadsheeting skills to the next level.
courseDescription:
In this online course Microsoft Excel 2013 - Advanced: Master Spreadsheets, learn about the advanced features and functions of Microsoft Excel 2013. The course starts by introducing you to the basic use of function and their arguments, along with how to find the one you want. Then you are taught about financial functions and how to use them, and about date and time functions.

Next the course talks about and demonstrates functions for statistical analysis of your data in Excel, moving to manipulating text with functions. Then the course will discuss how to use look up functions and apply logical operations into your functions. Finally, the course finishes by teaching you how to import data from external sources to your Excel spreadsheets and how to convert a selection in a spreadsheet to a table.

If you are interested in a career in data analysis, or you are a business/IT professional looking to learn new skills, then this is the course for you. Knowing how to use Excel for data analytics is a key skill in many business and IT departments, and this free online course will take your spreadsheeting skills to the next level. So, start this course today and by the end of the week you will have learned how to use advanced functions and formulas to help you supercharge your Excel skills.

Start Course Now

Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:

  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard.   • Upon successful completion of this module the learner will be able to:
    • Discuss the components that make up a function.
    • Recognize how to nest a function in a function.
    • Identify how to search for functions and get details and help on those functions in Excel.
    • Recognize the various ways in which the autosum function can accept cell ranges for its arguments.

  • List of Functions; Common Types of Arguments; Basic Use of Functions

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Advanced Aspects of Functions; Searching for a Function

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Autosum

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • The key points from this module are:
  • To manually type a function, you type the = symbol into the formula box, to start any function.

    A cell reference, refers to or points to a cell or range of cells in a worksheet, to use their data for a formula.

    You can have cell references to cells on other sheets.

    Functions can be nested within each other.

    The pie function is a function that takes no arguments.

    The insert function dialog box contains all the functions you can scroll through or search.

    The search in the insert function dialog box is fairly intelligent and will accept a descriptive sentence rather than just names of functions.

    The formula auto complete helps you with prompts of possible functions you could be looking for as you manually type a function into the formulas bar, narrowing down the results the more you type.
  • Upon successful completion of this module the learner will be able to:
    • Discuss using the Payment formula in Excel.
    • Recognize how to use the future value (FV) in Excel.
    • Discuss some of the most commonly used financial functions in Excel 2013.
    • Discuss the functions for calculating depreciation in value.

  • Payment

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Future Value

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Principal Payment

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Depreciations

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • The key points from this module are:
  • Many of the financial functions in Excel are for professional use only and have no practicality in personal use.

    The PMT function is one of the most commonly used financial functions in Excel; basically, it computes the periodic payments needed to pay a loan over a specific number of time periods.

    The Functions Arguments dialog box tells you what the function does, and what arguments the function requires. The mandatory arguments are bold in the dialog box and the optional arguments are not.

    The future value or FV function is used to work out the value of an investment over a period of time.

    When putting a calculation in a function, for example adding two cells together, you need to put the calculation inside parentheses ().

    The PDURATION function returns the number of periods required by an investment to reach a specified value.

    The RRI function returns an equivalent interest rate for the growth of an investment.

    The PPMT function returns the payment on the principal for a given investment based on periodic, constant payments and a constant interest rate.

  • Upon successful completion of this module the learner will be able to:
    • Recognize how Excel stores dates and times.
    • Identify the commonly used date and time functions.

  • How Dates and Times are Stored

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Dates and Times Calculation

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Exercise on Date and Time Functions; Date and Time Settings

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • The key points from this module are:
  • Excel stores dates as a count of a number of days, with time being stored as a fraction of a day.

    The NOW function returns the serial number of the current date and time.

    The TODAY function returns the serial number of today’s date.

    The DATEVALUE function converts a date in text format to a number that represents the date in Microsoft Excel date-time code.
  • Upon successful completion of this module the learner will be able to:
    • OutlinethethreedifferenttypesofstatisticalfunctionsinExcel.
    • Discuss using the Percentiles functions and the difference between them.
    • Discuss the use of regression predictions in Excel.

  • Statistical Functions for Description, Prediction and Inference

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Percentiles

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Regression

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • LINEST Function

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Example of Functions for Inferential Statistics

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • The key points from this module are:
  • MS Excel is used quite a bit in statistics, with many features and functions solely for the purpose of statistics. The statistics section has the greatest amount of dedicated functions compared to other areas of functions.

    Description statistical functions in Excel are ways of describing a set of data, its features, or comparing them to other sets.

    Prediction statistical functions in Excel predict what may happen in the future based on the trends in the data already available.

    Inference means to infer something from, for example, a population, by taking a sample from that population.

    Many of the older versions of certain functions are still available in Excel 2013 for backwards compatibility but they are superseded by newer versions with slightly the same name.

    You can define a name for a cell or a range of cells. Simply select the cells, right click and select "define name". Then enter the name you want in the text box.

    The AVERAGEIF function returns an average of a range of cells that meet a given criteria.
  • The key points from this module are:

    Description statistical functions in Excel are ways of describing a set of data, its features, or comparing them to other sets.

    Many of the older versions of certain functions are still available in Excel 2013 for backwards compatibility but they are superseded by newer versions with slightly the same name.

    You can define a name for a cell or a range of cells. Simply select the cells, right click and select "define name". Then enter the name you want in the text box.

    The AVERAGEIF function returns an average of a range of cells that meet a given criteria.
  • Upon successful completion of this module the learner will be able to:
    • Discuss the functionsformanipulatingtextinExcel2013.
    • Identify how to separate pieces of text into separate cells using functions.
    • Recognize how to convert a column, row or cells from text to a number or date format.
    • Identify how to remove leading and trailing spaces from text strings.

  • Text Function Case Study - 1

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Text Function Case Study - 2

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • The key points from this module are:
  • The PROPER function converts a text string to proper case, with the first letter changing to upper case, and all other letters to lowercase.

    The find function returns the starting position of one text string within another text string.

    By default, Excel aligns text to the left of a cell, and numbers to the right.

    The SUBSTITUTE function replaces existing text with specified new text in a text string.

    A problem with importing data can cause trailing and leading spaces. The function for removing these spaces is the TRIM function.

  • Upon successful completion of this module the learner will be able to:
    • DiscusstheuseoflookupfunctionsinExcel.
    • Recognize how to set up and use both the VLOOKUP and HLOOKUP functions.
    • Discuss the use of logical function in your Excel workbooks.
    • Recognise how to create an IFNA and an IF statement in a function. 

  • Lookup and Reference Functions

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Logical Functions

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • The key points from this module are:
  • There are fewer than 20 lookup and reference functions, with HLOOKUP and VLOOKUP among the most popular.

    In VLOOKUP the values looked up are vertical and in HLOOKUP the values are horizontal.

    You can define a name for a cell or range of cells: simply make the selection and in the formulas tab select "Define Name" from the defined names group.

    The VLOOKUP function looks for a value in the leftmost column of a table, and then returns a value in the same row from a column you specify.

    The HLOOKUP function looks for a value in the top row of a table or array of values and returns the value in the same column from the row you specify.

    When you enter a formula and the cell displays #N/A, your formula can’t find some of its arguments, or one or more arguments could be wrong or missing.

    The CHOOSE function chooses a value or action to perform from a list of values, based on an index number. This is ideally used when you have a small number of options/values.
  • The key points from this module are:

  • Upon successful completion of this module the learner will be able to:
    • Discusswaysandmethodsofconnectingandworkingontwodifferentworkbooksatthesametime.
    • Discuss and identify how to connect your Excel workbooks to a Microsoft Access database.
    • Recognize the reasons it would be useful to connect an Access database to an Excel workbook.
    • Identify how to connect Excel to data from the web.

  • Connecting to Other Workbooks

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Connecting to Access Data

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Connecting to Web Data

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • The key points from this module are:
  • Link data in one worksheet to another worksheet in the same workbook with copy and the paste special, or Paste Link, which pastes a reference to the cells on the worksheet the data is from.

    The New Window button in the View tab allows you to open a second window in your document, giving you the ability to work in different places at the same time.

    The Arrange All button just below the new window button lets you arrange how you view the two windows, for example, having them side by side.

    Closing one of the windows will not close the workbook.

    You can also select a range of cells and click and drag them to the other window you have open to either move, copy or link them to the sheet.

    If you paste a link between different workbooks, the link will have a full reference including the workbook's name. If the linked workbook is in a separate folder, you will need the file path to the Workbook.

    Linking an Access Database to your Excel workbook does not limit you to linking tables, and you can also link queries.

  • The key points from this module are:
  • Link data in one worksheet to another worksheet in the same workbook with copy and the paste special, or Paste Link, which pastes a reference to the cells on the worksheet the data is from.

    The New Window button in the View tab allows you to open a second window in your document, giving you the ability to work in different places at the same time.

    The Arrange All button just below the new window button lets you arrange how you view the two windows, for example, having them side by side.

    Closing one of the windows will not close the workbook.

    You can also select a range of cells and click and drag them to the other window you have open to either move, copy or link them to the sheet.

    If you paste a link between different workbooks, the link will have a full reference including the workbook's name. If the linked workbook is in a separate folder, you will need the file path to the Workbook.

    Linking an Access Database to your Excel workbook does not limit you to linking tables, and you can also link queries.

  • Upon successful completion of this module the learner will be able to:
    • Recognise how to create a table in Excel 2013.
    • Identify how to remove duplicates from your table.
    • Recognise how to format and modify the appearance of the table.
    • Discuss the process of referencing a table and/or table contents outside of the table.

  • Creating a Table and Changing Table Name; Filter; Removing Duplicates; Total Row

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Inserting Columns and Rows; Resizing Tables

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Table Reference

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Table Styles

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Table Selection

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • The key points from this module are:
  • When inserting a table, Excel will select what it thinks you want for a table if you only have one cell selected, it will even try and identify headers for your table from the data.

    You can rename your table in text box the far left corner of the Table tools design tab on the ribbon.

    Sorting and filtering are automatically setup for your table once you create it, which you can turn off.

    You an add a total row to your table simplify clicking a check box in the Table tools design tab, the total row, cells, have a drop-down arrow beside them to let you select the type of total formula use, e.g. sum, count, average, etc.

    To reference a table or contents in a table outside of the table, you need to use the name of the table, as part of the reference.

    When typing in a table reference, Excel 2013 will prompt you with available qualifiers for the reference.

    You can create and customize styles to suit your need and wants.

    You can convert a table back to a rage of cells but the formatting and styles you applied with remain even though its no longer a table. This process will also convert you table references to regular references that allows the formulas to still work.

    With selecting from a table, you have three main options; select table data, select table column, select table row. These can be combined make unique selections.

    You can perform all these selections with the mouse as well.
